intro: Isoleucas somala, commonly known as the Somalian leucas, is a flowering plant native to the arid regions of Somalia. It belongs to the family Asteraceae, which includes daisies and sunflowers, and is characterized by its composite flower heads. The plant typically grows as a shrub with woody stems and small, narrow leaves adapted to withstand drought conditions. Its flowers are usually yellow or orange, with a central disk surrounded by ray florets. Isoleucas somala plays a role in local ecosystems by providing habitat and nectar for pollinators in its native environment.
